solution_line_template: The total number of jewelry Jessy had before going to the store is {initial_necklaces} necklaces+{initial_earrings} earrings= <<{initial_necklaces}+{initial_earrings}={initial_total_jewelry}>>{initial_total_jewelry}
At the store, Jessy bought {fraction_bought_earrings}*{initial_earrings} = <<{fraction_bought_earrings}*{initial_earrings}={earrings_bought_at_store}>>{earrings_bought_at_store} earrings.

When she got back from the store, Jessy received {fraction_from_mother}*{earrings_bought_at_store} = <<{fraction_from_mother}*{earrings_bought_at_store}={earrings_from_mother}>>{earrings_from_mother} more earrings than the ones she bought at the store from her mother.

The total number of earrings Jessy received from her mother is {earrings_from_mother}+{earrings_bought_at_store} = <<{earrings_from_mother}+{earrings_bought_at_store}={total_earrings_received_from_mother}>>{total_earrings_received_from_mother} earrings.

The total number of earrings Jesy has after being given {total_earrings_received_from_mother} more from her mother is {earrings_bought_at_store}+{total_earrings_received_from_mother} = <<{earrings_bought_at_store}+{total_earrings_received_from_mother}={total_new_earrings}>>{total_new_earrings} earrings outside the jewelry box.

When Jessy puts all the jewelry in the box, the total number becomes {total_new_earrings} new earrings+ {new_necklaces_bought} new necklaces + {initial_total_jewelry}(the total number of jewelry she had before) = <<{total_new_earrings}+{new_necklaces_bought}+{initial_total_jewelry}={final_total_jewelry}>>{final_total_jewelry}
